p: We considered various types of community-based approach for the introduction of a clean-seed programme. Distributing uninfected planting material to different growers each season increases the probability of success in reducing yield loss (see, for example, [ 10, 11, 25]). However, ancillary challenges in encouraging uptake by growers as well as managing logistical constraints associated with bulkiness and perishability of cassava planting material would need to be addressed (see [ 13, 26]).
